item.title: 随着关税紧张局势缓和，交易员为 S&P 500 指数建立看涨模型
item.description: 中美贸易紧张局势的缓和使股市在周一飙升，这让图表观察家们预计 S&P 500 指数将再创历史新高。【原文：The reprieve in US-China trade tensions that sent stocks soaring on Monday has chart watchers anticipating fresh all-time highs for the S&P 500 Index.】

item.title: 泰国将发行 1.5 亿美元政府投资代币
item.description: 泰国财政部长披差-春哈瓦吉拉（Pichai Chunhavajira）在周二的发布会上表示，泰国财政部计划在两个月内发行价值 50 亿泰铢（约 1.5 亿美元）的新数字投资代币，此前该倡议已获得内阁批准。【原文：Thailand’s Finance Ministry plans to issue 5 billion baht (about $150 million) worth of a new digital investment token within two months, Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira said at a Tuesday briefing after the initiative was endorsed by the cabinet.】

item.title: Citadel 的格里芬说，在关税动荡中，套现可能是最好的选择
item.description: 在市场因中美贸易战休战而飙升之际，Citadel 公司创始人肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）对过去一个月进行了反思，他认为最好是持有现金观望。【原文：As markets soared on a truce in the trade war between the US and China, Citadel founder Ken Griffin reflected on the past month, suggesting it would have been better to sit on the sidelines in cash.】

item.title: 尽管贸易停战，芬克和弗雷泽仍从波动中看到机会
item.description: 尽管中美贸易休战，一些世界顶级金融领袖仍在为市场的持续波动做准备；但他们表示，不确定性也为投资创造了新的机会。【原文：Some of the world’s top financial leaders are preparing for continued market volatility despite the US-China trade truce — but say the uncertainty is also creating new openings for investment.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员敦促通过情景分析应对贸易动荡
item.description: 两位理事会成员表示，欧洲中央银行不应过分依赖其基线前景，必须做好准备，在经济增长和通胀与预期出现偏差时迅速做出反应。【原文：The European Central Bank shouldn’t rely too much on its baseline outlook and must be prepared to react quickly if economic growth and inflation diverge from expectations, according to two Governing Council members.】

item.title: 土耳其 150 亿美元储备损失创 2023 年投票以来之最
item.description: 土耳其的官方储备在 3 月份减少了 150 亿美元，这是自 2023 年总统选举以来的最大跌幅，反映出一位著名反对派政治家被监禁后投资者的担忧程度。【原文：Turkey’s official reserves fell by $15 billion in March, the steepest decline since the 2023 presidential elections, reflecting the extent of concern that’s gripped investors after the jailing of a prominent opposition politician.】

item.title: 美国银行调查显示大多数投资者错过了最近的股市反弹
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的策略师们表示，在错过了上个月的大部分反弹之后，投资者很可能被迫追逐中美贸易休战引发的股市反弹。【原文：Investors are likely to be forced to chase the stock rally sparked by the US-China trade truce after mostly missing out on last month’s rebound, Bank of America Corp. strategists said.】

item.title: 据称 KNDS 将就拒绝交付 18% 的伦克股份一事起诉 Triton
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，KNDS NV 已起诉私募股权公司 Triton Partners，指控其拒绝转让主要坦克供应商伦克集团（Renk Group AG）的股份。【原文：KNDS NV has sued private equity firm Triton Partners for refusing to transfer a stake in key tank supplier Renk Group AG, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美元大幅反弹，期权市场疑云重重
item.description: 美元缩减了周一的涨幅，交易员们不相信美元近期因中美贸易紧张局势缓和而出现的大涨会持续很长时间。【原文：The dollar pared Monday’s gains, with traders unconvinced that its recent surge on the back of easing US-China trade tensions will last long.】

item.title: 危机加深，日产放弃盈利预期，关闭工厂
item.description: 日产汽车公司（Nissan Motor Co.）暂缓发布年度利润指导，并表示将关闭生产工厂，因为这家汽车制造商正努力应对重组成本激增和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统贸易战影响的双重不利因素。【原文：Nissan Motor Co. withheld its annual profit guidance and said it will shut production plants as the carmaker struggles with the combined headwinds of surging restructuring costs and the fallout of President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: M&G 支持的英国加密衍生品交易场所首次亮相
item.description: 随着近期数字资产反弹提升了机构对数字资产的兴趣，由 M&G 投资公司（M&G Investments）支持、面向大型金融公司的一个新的伦敦加密货币衍生品交易场所首次亮相。【原文：A new London-based crypto derivatives venue, backed by M&G Investments and aimed at large financial firms, has made its debut, as the recent rally bolsters institutional interest in digital assets.】

item.title: 马莎百货称黑客窃取了部分客户数据
item.description: 玛莎百货集团（Marks & Spencer Group Plc）称，一些客户的个人数据被黑客窃取，这家英国零售商正在继续调查和处理一起破坏性极大的 "网络事件"。【原文：Marks & Spencer Group Plc said some personal customer data was stolen by hackers as the British retailer continues to investigate and manage a highly-damaging “cyber incident.”】

item.title: Bytes 首席执行官称微软合作伙伴将是英国推动人工智能发展的关键
item.description: Bytes Technology Group Plc 预计，英国利用人工智能提高公共服务效率的承诺将为转售和管理微软公司服务的公司带来福音。【原文：Bytes Technology Group Plc expects the UK’s commitment to using artificial intelligence to make public services more efficient to be a boon for companies that resell and manage Microsoft Corp. services.】

item.title: 阿尔巴尼亚总理在选举中获胜，增强了议会控制力
item.description: 阿尔巴尼亚总理埃迪-拉马（Edi Rama）在本周末的选举中巩固了他对议会的控制权，因为选民们相信他在 2030 年之前将阿尔巴尼亚带入欧盟的承诺。【原文：Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama cemented his control over parliament at this weekend’s election as voters bought into his pledges to take the nation into the European Union by 2030.】

item.title: 泰国向美国提交启动关税谈判的建议书
item.description: 泰国向美国提交了一系列关于如何促进进口和投资的建议，这是这个东南亚国家为推动特朗普政府就计划征收的 36% 出口关税展开正式谈判而做出的最新努力。【原文：Thailand has submitted a range of proposals to the US on how it plans to boost imports and promote investments, the latest bid by the Southeast Asian nation to nudge the Trump administration to begin formal talks over a planned 36% tariff on exports.】

item.title: SBB 首席执行官认为阿克尔公司的交易受到业主债权人的欢迎
item.description: 房东瑞典储蓄银行（SBB）和挪威阿克尔公司（Aker ASA）的房地产部门达成了一项协议，将为瑞典房地产集团带来新的大股东和更低的杠杆率。【原文：Landlord SBB and the property unit of Norway’s Aker ASA have struck a deal that will bring benefits to the Swedish property group in the form of a major new shareholder and a lower leverage ratio.】

item.title: 贝森特称欧盟在贸易问题上可能存在 "集体行动问题
item.description: 美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）淡化了与欧盟迅速达成贸易协定的可能性，称欧盟存在 "集体行动问题"，阻碍了谈判。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent downplayed the possibility of a quick trade agreement with the European Union, saying the bloc suffers from a “collective action problem” that’s hampering negotiations.】

item.title: 全球股市已从关税风暴中复苏
item.description: 自美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税攻势加速以来，全球股市基准在六周的过山车行情中收复了失地。【原文：Equity benchmarks around the world have recouped their losses in a roller-coaster six-week stretch since the acceleration of US President Donald Trump’s tariff offensive.】

item.title: 软银利润跃升得益于人工智能复原力的提升
item.description: 软银集团公司（SoftBank Group Corp. ）公布的季度财报显示，该公司实现了季度盈利，原因是人工智能需求的恢复性增长支撑了初创企业的估值和芯片销售，这也推动了该公司积极的数据中心投资计划。【原文：SoftBank Group Corp. reported a quarterly profit on resilient AI demand that’s supporting startup valuations and chip unit sales, a boost to its aggressive data center investment plans.】

item.title: 塞内加尔瓦锡兰电力项目开始油改气工程
item.description: 塞内加尔在上个月出口了第一批液化天然气燃料后，开始改造一座发电厂，使其使用液化天然气。【原文：Senegal began converting a power plant to operate on liquefied natural gas, after exporting its first consignment of the fuel last month.】

item.title: 印度否认特朗普利用贸易确保停战的说法
item.description: 印度官员否认与美国的贸易被用作印度和巴基斯坦之间刚刚结束的停火协议的筹码，这与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关于如果两国停止敌对行动，美国将与两国进行更多贸易的声明相矛盾。【原文：Indian officials denied that trade with the US was used as a bargaining chip in a just-concluded ceasefire between India and Pakistan, contradicting statements by President Donald Trump that the US offered to trade more with both countries if they stopped hostilities.】

item.title: 富兰克林称海湾地区股票将在新兴市场指数中发挥更大作用
item.description: 富兰克林邓普顿表示，由于该地区的 "深刻变革"，海湾地区证券交易所的股票在基准新兴市场股票指数中的比例将增加近一半。【原文：The representation of shares from Gulf stock exchanges in the benchmark emerging-market equity index is set to rise by almost half because of the region’s “profound transformation,” Franklin Templeton said.】

item.title: 罗马尼亚通胀持平，政治风险为前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 罗马尼亚上个月的通货膨胀率保持不变，共产主义解体以来最严重的政治危机将列伊汇率推至历史新低，这可能会加剧物价压力，并使央行下个月货币政策的观望态度复杂化。【原文：Romanian inflation remained unchanged last month as the gravest political crisis since the collapse of communism pushed the leu to a record low which will likely intensify price pressure and complicate the central bank’s wait-and-see approach to monetary policy in the coming month.】

item.title: 英国企业因增税和贸易战影响连续第三个月裁员
item.description: 由于260亿英镑（340亿美元）的增税政策生效，以及唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策使全球经济前景黯淡，英国企业在4月份连续第三个月裁员。【原文：British businesses cut jobs for a third straight month in April as a £26 billion ($34 billion) tax hike took effect and Donald Trump’s tariffs darkened the global economic outlook.】

item.title: 印度首次针对特朗普关税制度提出反制措施
item.description: 印度提议对部分美国商品征收关税，以回应华盛顿对钢铁和铝征收的关税，这标志着印度首次对唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税制度采取报复行动，尽管两国距离最终达成贸易协议已越来越近。【原文：India has proposed levies on some US goods in response to Washington’s duties on steel and aluminum, marking its first retaliation against President Donald Trump’s tariff regime, even as the two countries move closer to finalizing a trade deal.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英国股市有望在反弹后下挫，英镑走高
拜耳因癌症和肾脏新药收益超预期
item.description: 拜耳公司第一季度的盈利降幅低于预期，原因是对癌症和肾脏新药的强劲需求帮助抵消了农产品销售的下滑。【原文：Bayer AG’s earnings fell less than expected in the first quarter as robust demand for its new cancer and kidney medicines helped offset a decline in agricultural sales.】

item.title: 埃克萨罗煤矿公司将以 6.4 亿美元收购锰矿资产
item.description: 南非最大的煤矿商埃克萨罗资源有限公司（Exxaro Resources Ltd.）已同意以约 116.7 亿兰特（6.4 亿美元）的价格收购南非最大的锰矿。【原文：Exxaro Resources Ltd., South Africa’s biggest coal miner, has agreed to acquire the nation’s largest manganese mines for about 11.67 billion rand ($640 million).】

item.title: 洛杉矶野火造成 11 亿欧元损失，慕尼黑再保险公司利润减半
item.description: 慕尼黑再保险公司（Munich Re）第一季度利润下滑了近一半，原因是肆虐大洛杉矶地区的野火造成的损失影响了盈利。【原文：Munich Re’s first-quarter profit slumped by almost half as losses from wildfires that ravaged swaths of the greater Los Angeles area weighed on earnings.】

item.title: 美国贸易休战后中国取消波音飞机交付禁令
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，在与美国的贸易谈判取得突破性进展，双方都暂时削减了关税之后，中国已经取消了对航空公司接收波音公司飞机长达一个月的禁令。【原文：China has removed a month-long ban on airlines taking delivery of Boeing Co. planes, according to people familiar with the matter, following a breakthrough in trade talks with the US that temporarily slashed tariffs on each side.】
